content.description: A fun, balancey, barn-door problem. Clip first bolt high on the arete from a good pocket out left. Climb through delicate moves on stellar rock. Traddies will onsight this route with ease, others might have a tough time.
content.location: Left-most route on clean arete by juniper tree. Just above where trail steps down a short dip to surpass around large juniper. Start off the large block below the obvious arete on the left side of the wall. Shares the same arete as Pontius', but climbs the left side (less steep). For now, these routes share the same anchor.

content.description: Start on a slightly over vertical face with good edges and pockets. Mantle onto a ledge and clip a high bolt to pull the bulge via a stem corner to its right.
content.location: Starts on some smaller boulders to the right of the large block at the base of the wall. Two different options for the start, both fun through good pockets and edges.

content.description: Testpiece of the sector. Steep climbing off the ground with fun and engaging movement through several cruxes. Dont underestimate the finishing moves surpassing the bulge via flat holds on the arete to the left.
content.protection: 6 bolts, anchors. Totally possible to hang the draws while lowering from The Trial.
content.location: Starts from the large block at the base of the right hand side of the arete. Step off the block and into the dihedral to a very generous pocket to clip the first bolt.

content.description: A sector with shorter routes but of very high quality basalt. yielding a variety of fun and challenging lines.
